oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kompostierung von Ziegenmist: Einfluss der Umsetzungshäufigkeit auf die Überlebensraten von Parasitenlarven
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Podstatzky, Leopold
Wenzl, Wilfried
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheep and goats
Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three different methods of composting (no reverse, 2xreverse, 5xrevers) were conducted in summer and winter over a period of 62 days with respect to the survival of endoparasites. Highest temperatures were reached in compost hills without reversing. Reversing lowered the temperature. Maximum temperatures were almost 70°C but in winter highest temperatures nearly reached 55°C. After two weeks of composting in winter temperatures were always under 40°C. In summer no parasitic larvae could be detected at the end of the trial independent of reverse frequency. In winter larvae could be counted at the end of the trial.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Podstatzky, Leopold and Wenzl, Wilfried (2013) Kompostierung von Ziegenmist: Einfluss der Umsetzungshäufigkeit auf die Überlebensraten von Parasitenlarven. Paper at: 12. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität, Bonn, 5. bis 8. März 2013.
